The routine should prioritize calming, non-comedogenic products suitable for sensitive skin types. perQuestion.query: My skin breaks out easily. How should I cleanse my face without making acne worse?
perQuestion.denseRetrievalText: Searching for gentle cleansing methods suitable for acne-prone, breakout-sensitive skin. Focus on non-comedogenic, fragrance-free cleansers that effectively remove impurities without disrupting the skin barrier or causing irritation. Recommendations should address minimizing pore clogging and inflammation, avoiding harsh exfoliants or strong acids that could exacerbate acne. Ideal cleansing routine timing is twice daily (AM and PM) to maintain skin balance and prevent excess oil buildup. Emphasis on formulations that support barrier repair and reduce sebum without stripping moisture. Guidance on avoiding over-cleansing or aggressive scrubbing to prevent worsening acne symptoms is also relevant. Skin type is unspecified beyond acne-prone and sensitive to breakouts.
